comments.content: Is this a bug? ChanceScheduler is just that: a host selected by chance. There is not supposed to be any checking of suitability in this class; for that matter, it doesn't check if a host is capable of running the image OS, or is even the correct type of hypervisor.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ed-leafe

comments.content: I think the bug should be change the default scheduler to something that works in more situations :)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content: Then we should mark in comments and a LOG.warn about using a scheduler that will mask errors.  I think it is reasonable to expect NoValidHost to be raised by _any_ scheduler when a host can't accept the instance.  We should be very vocal if we're not going to blindly trust compute hosts.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~xtoddx

comments.content:
On Fri, Aug 5, 2011 at 1:45 PM, Vish Ishaya <email address hidden> wrote:
> I think the bug should be change the default scheduler to something that
> works in more situations :)

++

There was a tweet a few weeks ago saying something to the effect of
"Nova doesn't even check to see if a machine has capacity before it
tries to put a VM on it... FAIL." Can't remember the tweet link, and I
searched for it, but that basically paraphrases it well...

-jay
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes

comments.content: Definitely agree, Vish and Jay. Should we just file a new bug to change the default scheduler?

comments.content: Not sure... could use this bug I suppose, just changing the description/summary...

comments.content:
Any ideas of what scheduler to switch over to?  

What about leaving MultiScheduler as default.

flags.DEFINE_string('scheduler_driver',
                    'nova.scheduler.multi.MultiScheduler',
                    'Default driver to use for the scheduler')

And DistributedScheduler for compute calls, and 
         VsaScheduler for volume placement?

flags.DEFINE_string('compute_scheduler_driver',
                    'nova.scheduler.distributed_scheduler.DistributedScheduler',
                    'Driver to use for scheduling compute calls')
flags.DEFINE_string('volume_scheduler_driver',
                    'nova.scheduler.vsa.VsaScheduler',
                    'Driver to use for scheduling volume calls')
